In baseball, a pitcher throws a pitch to a batter. The batter attempts to hit the ball with a bat. The pitcher throws the ball in such a way that the batter cannot hit it cleanly so that the batter either allows the pitch to pass through the strike zone or misses the ball completely. In this way, the pitcher controls the game.

Baseball is a bat-and-ball game played between two opposing teams who take turns batting and fielding. The game proceeds when a player on the fielding team, called the pitcher, throws a ball which a player on the batting team tries to hit with a bat.

In baseball, a home run is scored when the ball is hit in such a way that the batter is able to circle the bases and reach home safely in one play without any errors being committed by the defensive team in the process.
